section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਨਾ ਇਹੁ ਮਾਨਸੁ ਨਾ ਇਹੁ ਦੇਉ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It is not human, and it is not a god.

transliteration.text: nā ih mānas nā ih dēu .

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It is not called celibate, or a worshipper of Shiva.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

translation.text: It is not a Yogi, and it is not a hermit.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

text: ਨਾ ਇਸੁ ਮਾਇ ਨ ਕਾਹੂ ਪੂਤਾ ॥੧॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It is not a mother, or anyone's son. ||1||

transliteration.text: nā is māi n kāhū pūtā .1.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Then what is it, which dwells in this temple of the body?

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

text: ਤਾ ਕਾ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਕੋਊ ਪਾਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: No one can find its limits. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: tā kā ant n kōū pāī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

text: ਨਾ ਇਹੁ ਰਾਜ ਨ ਭੀਖ ਮੰਗਾਸੀ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It is not a king, and it is not a beggar.

transliteration.text: nā ih rāj n bhīkh mangāsī .

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

text: ਨਾ ਇਸੁ ਪਿੰਡੁ ਨ ਰਕਤੂ ਰਾਤੀ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It has no body, no drop of blood.

transliteration.text: nā is pind n rakatū rātī .

Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

translation.text: It is not called a man of austere self-discipline, or a Shaykh.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It does not live, and it is not seen to die.

transliteration.text: nā ih jīvai n maratā dēkh .

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If someone cries over its death,

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, I have found the Path.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Birth and death have both been erased.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਇਹੁ ਰਾਮ ਕੀ ਅੰਸੁ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, this is formed of the same essence as the Lord.

transliteration.text: kah kabīr ih rām kī ans .

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

text: ਜਸ ਕਾਗਦ ਪਰ ਮਿਟੈ ਨ ਮੰਸੁ ॥੪॥੨॥੫॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It is like the ink on the paper which cannot be erased. ||4||2||5||

transliteration.text: jas kāgad par mitai n mans .4.2.5.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility.
